cab.content: WAR CABINET Recruiting.Memorandum by the Secretary of State for War'.,The subjoined note which has been drawn up by the Adjutant General I submit for the information of the War Cabinet.DERBY18.8e17.I regret again to have to draw attention to the dangerous state to which our drafting requirements have fallen.The Retruiting Table up to the end of July sent te the War Cabinet, shows that in the month of July the intake of recruits was the lowest by over 20.000 of any month in 1917, the numbers of MAn men over 19 years of age being only 23,120 those under 19 - 9,147,,* and lower categories 28,100.The figures for the month of August up to and including the 14th, are -Category MA" 13,513Lower Cate*goriea 10,390The British infantry in Prance is some 40,000 under strength, not counting drafts under orders today, while some 30,000 lower categories on demand for Transportation, R.A.M.C., and Labour, are not at present forthcoming.I suggest that it is imperative that some drastic action be taken to increase the influx of retruite, if the Army is to be maintained at its present establishment.
